channel.title: Purposly underclock your computer and CMOS time battery
channel.description:
First of all, do not ask why the heck I would want to ever do this :rolleyes: .
I know how to over clock small processors. but how would you underclock one?
take for example the ARM processor in a GBA, how would you reduce the hertz it runs?

item.title: Purposly underclock your computer and CMOS time battery
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

processors wouldn’t know the difference at the speed they are processing, they just process at a rate.

GBA’s are just an example, but for any processor under a standard schematic

Read full topic
item.source: Purposly underclock your computer and CMOS time battery

item.title: Purposly underclock your computer and CMOS time battery
item.dc:creator: @DeadBird DeadBird
item.description:
@DeadBird wrote:

Why would you want to underclock a GBA? You would probably kill the thing as some of it’s launch titles use it’s capabilities as far as the devs could go…

Read full topic
item.source: Purposly underclock your computer and CMOS time battery
